pageContext.claim: “We have a much better prototype...I've always said part of the wall was that previous administrations, when they did little walls, they built them so badly. So badly. It's so unattractive. So -- I wouldn't want them in my backyard.”
pageContext.analysis: The president may not particularly like the existing designs for barriers at the U.S.-Mexico border, but it’s wrong to suggest they are “little.” The most common varieties being constructed at the border are 18 to 30 feet tall. Plus, Congress has not approved any of Trump’s prototypes. Any wall repairs must be done with existing designs.
